bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 20, 1914

div1.p: Blue assigns Carter to represent the Health Service at the Drainage Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 20, 1914
div1.opener:
JKb
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 20, 1914.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
United States Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
You are hereby detailed to represent the Service at
a meeting of the section for the eradication of malaria
of the Drainage Congress, to be held at Savannah April
22, 1914. You will present a paper on this Subject, and
take part in any matters affecting this Service which
may come before the Congress.

While on this detail, your status will be that of
special temporary duty, and upon completion of the detail,
you will rejoin your station in Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. A W S
The expenses incurred while carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
R B
✓
